reviews.review_msg: The course is based mostly on exams, and the professor goes through mock midterms and finals through YouTube videos, and you will be given a cheat sheet. The only thing I didn't like was that the professor didn't use Canvas to upload assignments or grades. I highly recommend this course for a chill time and good content to learn without stressing.

George makes this class much easier than it should be. he is a good professor who cares about his students. makes exams very fair and clear. does not try to make things overly complicated. pretty funny guy keeps lectures interesting. overall would take a class with him again. only thing i dont like is that he doesnt use canvas for assignments
Very caring about this class, did not care about spending extra time on youtube videos to ensure we understood. hes a good guy

He's rather slow paced in his talking but it's all the more better, this provides a better understanding and grasp on what seemed to be an abstract topic. He will usually prompt the class for questions, though I think most of them were really well explained. He adds a tinge of humour sometimes as well during lecture. Overall a really nice prof!
fun class, not too stressed through out the course. Exams were fairly short.
Great practical course. Very knowledgable  and caring prof. Pick a right group, as it affects your final grade. I wish I could take more courses with him.

He doesn't know how to teach. He teaches you the basics and gives you an extremely hard assignment leaving you to fail. When you don't know how to do something even when he didn't teach it, he makes you feel bad and keeps trying to push you for an answer. Very disrespectful and would not recommend anyone to take this class with him.
This course is great, with real life application. Payman is awsome and available for extra help. Just attend the class, and do provided sample exams. You will easily ace this course.

be ready to teach yourself... payman is a nice guy and is funny during lectures but he doesn't explain things clearly. he assumes you already understand everything. half of this semester was done through recorded videos and his examples are from 2005. questions on exams were completely new and not covered in class... gg if you have him

Payman is like a double edged sword. His lectures in general are fun as he can be quite hilarious, but his tests, projects, and presentations are TOUGH. Especially the presentations, make sure you are well prepared and can argue your decisions/assumptions or he WILL tear you apart in front of class. IMO projects are too hard
easy course. great prof. attend the class and participate in discussions. you will easily ace it.

I enjoyed this class with Payman. The lectures were fun, and the material was interesting. Do not both to contact him within the last two weeks of the course. He will not respond. Give yourself lots of time for the final project because it is HARD!

In my 5 years at SFU, Payman was easily my least favourite professor. He is very intelligent, but gives no direction and is not accessible outside of class. His lecture slides and teaching method are stuck somewhere in the 90's and could use a 21st century update. If you do take this class with him, go to lecture and pay attention, and good luck

One of the best prof I have ever had. No textbook meaning you HAVE TO attend his classes and review his ppts to do well. Materials are highly simplified and he tends to repeat crucial concepts again and again to make sure everything is clear, and he marks you effort and understanding of materials over the right answers. Aws pro
Greatest prof I've ever had in sfu!

Payman is almost too slow in the lectures some times. He makes sure that most everyone can understand the material. He is a pretty easy marker as well and gives reasonable tests. However, he loves to play favorites and can't stand arrogant or aggressive people. SERIOUSLY, be overly nice and really modest or he'll grill you.
Was a great prof; reviewed all the important materials from previous classes. Follow his instructions and you ace this course easily.

Fantastic prof!  Payman is clearly a teacher, not just a professor. As long as you attend class and try, you will learn and do well.  He does play favorites a bit, but all you need to do is participate in class.

Extremely helpful. Clear in everything explained. His powerpoints and lectures are organized and fun. You won't be disappointed if you review his lecture notes covered before the next class everyweek and try hard to participate in class.

Great Professor in SFU. Interactive class structure, not boring at all!!! Have to read the case before you go to his class. Exams are fair. A difficult class; however, he tried to make it very interesting, and he succeeded in doing so!
Very Knowledgeable prof. extremely helpful, makes 437 an understandable course for the students. Excellent addition to the management science area.
